item.title: Law: Money matters most in the Dodgers-Braves Kemp trade
item.description: The impact of the reigning NL champs swapping four players to Atlanta for Matt Kemp will be felt more on both teams' bottom lines than on the field.

item.title: Why the Cubs should make Addison Russell-for-Manny Machado blockbuster trade
item.description: Dealing four years of Russell for one of Machado might seem like a lot, but bringing the O's star to Wrigley needs to be No. 1 on the Cubs' to-do list.

item.title: Reports: Brewers reach deal with Gallardo
item.description: Right-hander Yovani Gallardo is returning to the team he began his major league career with, as he has agreed to a deal with the Milwaukee Brewers, according to reports.

item.title: 2B Murphy on crutches 8 weeks after surgery
item.description: Nationals second baseman Daniel Murphy ambled around the team's annual fan festival with the aid of a pair of crutches and declined to offer any sort of estimate about the length of his recovery from right knee surgery.

item.title: Dodgers get tax relief, Kemp in 5-player trade
item.description: The Braves traded Matt Kemp to the Dodgers in exchange for veterans Adrian Gonzalez, Brandon McCarthy, Scott Kazmir and Charlie Culberson in a move that gave L.A. some luxury tax relief. Atlanta subsequently designated Gonzalez for assignment.

item.title: Agent: Sabathia rejoining Yanks to chase title
item.description: Following an excellent 2017 season, CC Sabathia will return to the Yankees in 2018 to pursue a World Series title, according to his agent.

item.title: A's Fowler suing White Sox, ballpark over injury
item.description: After suffering an injury in Chicago on June 29, Athletics outfielder Dustin Fowler is suing the White Sox and the state agency that manages Guaranteed Rate Field.

item.title: Rangers get LHP Moore in deal with Giants
item.description: Veteran left-hander Matt Moore, who went 6-15 with a 5.52 ERA for the Giants last season, has been traded to the Rangers along with international signing bonus pool money in exchange for two minor league pitchers.

item.title: Angels sign ex-Reds SS Cozart to 3-year deal
item.description: The Los Angeles Angels made their third high-profile acquisition this month, signing former Reds shortstop Zack Cozart to a three-year deal worth $38 million. The All-Star also agreed to be the team's third baseman.

item.title: Who can make an offer for Manny Machado the Orioles can't refuse?
item.description: Almost everyone could use the O's star, but only a few clubs have enough to land him. From one-year rentals to long-term homes, here are the best fits.

item.title: After signing Zack Cozart, the Angels are headed to the postseason if ...
item.description: Now that Los Angeles continued its winter shopping spree by adding another All-Star to its lineup, nothing can stop the Halos from making a 2018 return to October baseball -- right?

item.title: Cold stove: The four teams no one talked about at the winter meetings
item.description: It was a quiet week in Orlando, but for a quartet of clubs, it was practically dead silent. We tracked the rumor mill -- and found a group that generated almost no buzz whatsoever. What does that say about each?

item.title: Law: Phillies, Angels upgrade infields with pair of this offseason's most coveted free agents
item.description: Philly splurged for Carlos Santana and Los Angeles added to its winter haul by landing Zack Cozart. How much will the hitters help their new teams?

item.title: Law: Cards do right by Piscotty, Angels fill a black hole at second
item.description: St. Louis shipped Stephen Piscotty back home to Cali to be closer to his ailing mom, while the Halos upgraded at a major weak spot.

item.title: Law: Rule 5 draft features intriguing names -- for a change
item.description: Think the annual end-of-winter-meetings ritual isn't worth your time? Here's why some of this year's picks could turn heads in their new homes.

item.title: Carlos Santana signing a significant step in Phillies' rebuild
item.description: They're still a long way from contention, but the Phils improved without overpaying -- leaving them in play for both Harper and Machado next winter.

item.title: Working out with Kyle Schwarber: Exclusive look at Cubs slugger's mission to transform his body
item.description: Cubs outfielder Kyle Schwarber gives us a peek into what his daily life has been like since the Cubs lost in the NLCS.

item.title: Reports: Phillies add slugger Santana for $60M
item.description: The Philadelphia Phillies have agreed to a three-year, $60 million deal with free agent first baseman Carlos Santana, according to multiple reports.

item.title: Phillies trade starting SS Galvis to Padres
item.description: The Philadelphia Phillies have traded shortstop Freddy Galvis to the San Diego Padres, the team announced on Friday.

item.title: Rose defamation suit against Dowd dismissed
item.description: A federal court judge in Pennsylvania dismissed Pete Rose's defamation lawsuit against John Dowd Friday after the two sides reached an agreement prior to Rose being deposed.
